intro: Sphaeralcea chilensis, commonly known as Chilean globemallow, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Sphaeralcea chilensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in drought conditions.
